content: Please use the desktop or tablet to access the <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message prompting users to access the "<sectionName>" settings on the desktop site instead of the mobile app. The text appears when accessing certain settings on a mobile device.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'الرجاء استخدام سطح المكتب أو الجهاز اللوحي للوصول إلى <1>{{sectionName}}</1>' is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Arabic. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'يرجى استخدام جهاز الكمبيوتر أو الجهاز اللوحي للوصول إلى <1>{{sectionName}}</1>' or 'للوصول إلى <1>{{sectionName}}</1>، يرجى استخدام جهاز كمبيوتر أو جهاز لوحي'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: للوصول إلى <1>{{sectionName}}</1>، يرجى استخدام جهاز كمبيوتر أو جهاز لوحي.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of `<1>{{sectionName}}</1>` appears to be a placeholder and should be consistent across both the English and Arabic versions. Ensure that the placeholder is correctly implemented and renders properly in the target environment.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the placeholder implementation and ensure it functions as intended in the user interface.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'daxil olmaq üçün' (to enter) doesn't quite capture the meaning of 'access'. A more suitable phrase would be something along the lines of 'əldə etmək üçün' (to obtain/have access to).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{sectionName}}</1>-ə əldə etmək üçün masaüstü və ya planşetdən istifadə edin.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the `<1>` tags are present, ensuring they are consistent with the application's markup language is important. This is not an error *per se*, but something to confirm.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm the `<1>` tags align with the application's markup language.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses `<1>` and `</1>` to mark the variable. The Czech translation uses the same tags, which is consistent but worth noting for potential template integration considerations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the template rendering engine correctly handles `<1>` and `</1>` tags in the Czech context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "Please use the desktop or tablet" is too literal. A more natural Spanish phrasing would be "Utilice una computadora de escritorio o una tableta".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Utilice una computadora de escritorio o una tableta para acceder a <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Ole hyvä ja käytä työpöytää tai tablettia käyttääksesi' is a bit clunky. A more natural Finnish phrasing would be 'Käytä työpöytää tai tablettia päästäksesi' or 'Ole hyvä ja käytä työpöytää tai tablettia päästäksesi'. 'Käyttääksesi' is grammatically correct, but less common in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Käytä työpöytää tai tablettia päästäksesi

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Please use the desktop or tablet' is translated as 'Veuillez utiliser un PC ou une tablette'. While not strictly wrong, 'ordinateur' would be a more general and commonly understood translation for 'desktop' in this context, especially given the mobile warning. 'PC' is quite specific.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Veuillez utiliser un ordinateur ou une tablette...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English sentence implies a request or instruction to *use* desktop/tablet. The Italian translation, while technically correct, loses some of the polite and directive tone. A more appropriate translation might emphasize the necessity of using desktop/tablet.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Per accedere alla sezione <1>{{sectionName}}</1>, si prega di utilizzare il desktop o il tablet.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags <1>...</1> are identical in both English and Italian. While this might be intentional, it's worth verifying if the Italian system uses the same tags and how they are intended to be handled.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm if the <1> tags are intended to be identical and properly rendered in the Italian interface.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "デスクトップまたはタブレットで<1>{{sectionName}}</1>にアクセスしてください" is a literal translation but sounds unnatural in Japanese. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of "デスクトップまたはタブレットから<1>{{sectionName}}</1>にアクセスしてください" or "<1>{{sectionName}}</1>は、デスクトップまたはタブレットでご利用ください". The phrase 'にアクセスしてください' is grammatically correct, but a more polite and natural wording would be preferable in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>{{sectionName}}</1>は、デスクトップまたはタブレットでご利用ください。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The bracketed variable <1>{{sectionName}}</1> appears identical in both the English and Japanese versions. While this isn't technically an error, it's worth considering whether the placement and styling of the variable are appropriate for Japanese UI conventions. It might benefit from a different bracket style.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a bracket style more common in Japanese UI, e.g., {sectionName} or (sectionName).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses `<1>` and `</1>` tags around `{{sectionName}}`. The Korean translation also uses these tags. While technically correct, it's unusual to include the tags when presenting the message to the user.  Consider removing the tags in the final delivered text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` and `</1>` tags from the Korean translation when displayed to the user: "{{sectionName}}에 액세스하려면 데스크톱이나 태블릿을 사용하세요."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Latvian translation retains the `<1>` tags, which are likely meant for dynamic content insertion and should be handled appropriately in the implementation, but are not ideal in the raw translation string.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the `<1>` tags from the translation and let the application handle dynamic content insertion.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation maintains the bracketed section name <1>{{sectionName}}</1> which is consistent with the English original. This indicates the formatting is correctly preserved.

The English phrase "Please use the desktop or tablet to access" has been shortened to "Use". The polite request implied by "Please" is lost in translation. While technically accurate, it's less user-friendly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Por favor, use o desktop ou tablet para acessar

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Please use...' is missing from the Portuguese translation. The instruction is more polite in English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Por favor, use o desktop ou tablet para acessar <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Utilizaţi desktopul sau tabletă pentru a accesa <1>{{sectionName}}</1>." is a literal translation, but in Romanian, it's more natural to say 'Vă rugăm să utilizați...' (Please use...).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vă rugăm să utilizați desktopul sau tableta pentru a accesa <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Please use the desktop or tablet" is better translated as "Пожалуйста, используйте компьютер или планшет" rather than simply "используйте компьютер или планшет". The addition of 'Пожалуйста' adds politeness.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Пожалуйста, используйте компьютер или планшет.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "කරුණාකර" is overly formal for a warning prompt. A more natural and user-friendly alternative would be "ඔයා".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔයා දේශපතුල හෝ ටැබ්ලට් භාවිතයෙන් <1>{{sectionName}}</1> වෙත පිවිසිය යුතුයි.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While generally correct, confirming 'දේශපතුල' is the most accurate spelling is recommended. It could potentially be 'දේශපටුල' or other minor variations, though 'දේශපතුල' is likely correct based on common usage.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the spelling of 'දේශපතුල'.  If alternative spellings exist that are more common, use that instead.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses "Please use the desktop or tablet to access..." while the Slovak translation directly states "To access... please use..." This changes the tone and emphasis. A more natural Slovak translation would mirror the original structure more closely.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Prosím použite počítač alebo tablet na prístup k <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag <1>{{sectionName}}</1> is present in both English and Slovak. While not inherently wrong, it's worth noting as a potential point of inconsistency in how this element is handled across different languages if the tag's functionality or display is sensitive to locale.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, but review tag functionality across all locales.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Please use" is missing from the Slovenian translation. The translation should imply a request or suggestion, similar to the English version.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Za dostop do <1>{{sectionName}}</1> prosim uporabite namizje ali tablico.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'access' is best translated as 'приступите' rather than 'приступите'. While 'приступите' can technically work, 'приступите' is more natural and idiomatic in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Молимо користите десктоп или таблет да приступите <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Molimo koristite desktop ili tablet da pristupite <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.' is a direct translation but doesn't flow naturally in Serbian. A more idiomatic translation would be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Molim vas, koristite desktop ili tablet za pristup <1>{{sectionName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of <1> tags is preserved. Verify this is the desired formatting in the target system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, but confirm formatting requirements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content has `<1>{{sectionName}}</1>` markup. The Turkish translation also includes `<1>{{sectionName}}</1>`. This should be verified that the markup is intended and consistent with the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm whether the markup `<1>{{sectionName}}</1>` is necessary and consistent across both languages. If not, remove or adjust as needed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses `<1>` and `</1>` as placeholders, and the Ukrainian translation also uses similar tags. Ensure these tags are consistent throughout the product and documentation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify that `<1>` and `</1>` are the correct placeholder tags and are consistently applied across all locales.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are present in both the English and Vietnamese versions, which suggests they are placeholders for dynamic content. This is fine, but ensuring consistency in tag usage across all locales is recommended.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm that the tags `<1>` and `</1>` are consistently used and handled correctly in the application for all locales.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation is too literal and doesn't flow naturally in Chinese. While technically correct, it sounds somewhat robotic. A more natural phrasing would better suit the context of a user notification.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 请使用电脑或平板设备访问<1>{{sectionName}}</1>。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of '桌面' (desktop) and '平板电脑' (tablet computer) might be slightly too formal for a user-facing notification. While not incorrect, '电脑' (computer) and '平板设备' (tablet device) are slightly more common and user-friendly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 请使用电脑或平板设备访问<1>{{sectionName}}</1>。
